column1: This is why the Senate needs to pass the #HeroesAct. #COVID19 https://t.co/RVm59GsSwj

New Mexicans shared their #Thanksgiving2020 stories with me. I'm so grateful for everyone who found creative ways to celebrate with their families and loved ones. #COVIDー19 1/4 https://t.co/9J0ZMLkZ8O

With the spread of #COVID19 at an all time high we have to be vigilant. Stay home if you can wash your hands frequently keep a safe distance from others and wear a mask.   Masks save lives.  https://t.co/D4mFpirKmo

As #COVID19 cases continue to rise I want to thank all of our frontline workers for supporting our communities through this crisis.  Lets do our part & continue to wear masks & social distance for their safety & health.  https://t.co/qsrpukBnzt
Excellent piece about #COVID19 and its impact on Tribal communities by the All Pueblo Council of Governors Chairman Wilfred Herrera Jr. in the  @ABQJournal today:  https://t.co/K0ZKEmpjbk
I’m grateful for @GovMLG’s work to expand #COVID19 testing sites throughout the state. https://t.co/s21owKA9Sp
I spoke to @Grist about my fight to protect communities disproportionally affected by climate change especially in the midst of the #COVID19 pandemic. #TimeToThrive #30by30 https://t.co/sywQWcraBf

I’m fighting for COVID relief for families & small businesses in Congress. As we stay inside to keep our communities safe I want to know how you support local businesses.  Reply to this tweet & let me know! ⬇️
The outgoing Administration is weaponizing the #COVID19 pandemic by unlawfully expelling asylum seekers. It’s a human rights violation and must stop now. https://t.co/dtuSblteMH

Thank you for sharing your story @DayHochmanVigil. Sending my best to you and your family.   We can all play a role in protecting our communities by staying home when we can wearing a mask social distancing & washing our hands. #AllTogetherNM #COVID19 https://t.co/o2OKX3NofW
For #VeteransDay tomorrow @NatlParkService will be honoring our country’s veterans by offering free admission to all!   Please remember to stay safe social distance & #RecreateResponsibly.
President-elect Joe Biden is moving quickly to address the pandemic so we can get the economy running again with his #COVID19 Task Force.   https://t.co/OkzO0Zoocm
As #COVID19 cases continue to rise it’s even more important that you get your flu shot.  You can find your nearest flu shot provider here: https://t.co/pu4sNbEnhx

My heart goes out to all the students Prentis Jones mentored and coached and the entire Rio Grande High School community. It’s a tragedy that he died of #COVID related issues — please let’s all take care of each other and wear our masks. https://t.co/HPQ2sOp6Cp

We can all play a part in helping our health care heroes by wearing a mask staying home when we can washing our hands often & keeping a safe distance from others. #COVID19 #maskupNM https://t.co/tW7gfsvLzF
We saw a record number of #COVID19 cases recorded yesterday.  Don’t forget to wear a mask for your health & the health of our communities. https://t.co/inA8xfIhZO
Visite mi centro de información de Coronavirus que ahora tiene la información actualizada sobre asistencia con la renta e hipoteca. #COVID19 https://t.co/WkOGekubqk
My #Coronavirus Info Center now has updated information about rent & mortgage assistance. English & Spanish info here: https://t.co/WkOGekubqk
It’s up to every single one of us to curb the spread of #COVID19. As we exercise our right to #vote tomorrow wear a mask keep a safe distance & wash your hands.  https://t.co/oQjH17qN4t

.@COVIDOversight released reports on the White House Coronavirus Task Force showing #TrumpKnew about widespread #COVID19 cases yet continued to downplay the threat of the virus & put people at risk by hosting crowded events. Now more than HALF the US is in the “red zone." https://t.co/3xEQeTZlzg

To families across New Mexico each one of these cases is a loved one. Let's protect our communities. Wear a mask when you're out keep a safe distance from others wash your hands and stay home if you can. #COVID19 #MaskUp https://t.co/AkEXQZigV9
As #COVID19 cases rise in NM we’re calling on federal agencies to provide full transparency regarding NM’s share of stockpiled PPE. https://t.co/xeAe2kbxz9
There are food assistance programs specifically made to help families during the pandemic. I added them to my website’s #COVID19 Info Center.  More info here: https://t.co/WkOGekcA1K

This year #Halloween is going to be a little different but that doesn’t mean you can’t get dressed up. I used to make Somah’s costume every year and we had a blast. It’s a great project to do safely at home instead of increasing the risks of #COVID19 by trick-or-treating. https://t.co/e3ruPZDysH
Historically Black Colleges and Universities embrace the strengths & resilience of Black communities. Now they’re doing work to help fight #COVID19 disparities. #HBCUDay https://t.co/oWExAKy9uJ
My office’s #COVID19 info center now has bilingual information on how to spot #COVID19 scams.   Protect yourself & your family with info here: https://t.co/WkOGekubqk
Some tips to help New Mexico curb the spread of #COVID19: 😷#MaskUp 🚰Wash your hands 🏠Stay home 📏Keep a safe distance  https://t.co/RtwYYVSNq3

We’ve known that our healthcare system has failed Native communities. The #COVID19 pandemic puts a spotlight on the gaps in access to mental health services.  It’s on the GOP to pass the #HeroesAct2 & get the necessary $2.3 billion in funding for @IHSgov.  https://t.co/CF3nh7KK1i

This pandemic weighs heavy on our hearts and  our health care system is struggling to keep up.   Our communities are strong. Let’s work together. Wear a mask stay home if you can wash your hands and keep a safe distance. #COVID19 https://t.co/xteZJa4CyW
The Senate needs to take up the #HeroesAct2. #COVID19 https://t.co/osUwkHgtqv
It will take all of us to make this better for our state. Wear a mask stay home if you can wash your hands and keep a safe distance. #COVID19 #MaskUpNM https://t.co/EaHNYThFH4
We’re in this together. Wear your mask stay home if you can wash your hands and social distance. #MaskUpNM https://t.co/plUemO3kJ0

President Trump should be ashamed of himself. Instead of blaming our Gold Star families who have made the ultimate sacrifice for our country he should have come up with a comprehensive #COVID19 plan months ago. https://t.co/UTpV8hqaVK
Congrats to our 2020 #FatBearWeek champ!  I commend @KatmaiNPS’s 747 for his coronation as our chunky king. https://t.co/2C3ht95v6T

That’s why I voted to pass the #HeroesAct2 a #COVID19 relief package that will address the health & economic needs of families & small biz. This includes an estimated $1.77 billion for NM & as much as $335 million in relief for local governments in our district. #ForThePeople
This President has time to rush a #SCOTUS nomination instead of providing needed relief to families who are hurting right now. Heartless. #COVID19 https://t.co/KU3Jby22e9

It’s on all of us especially the President to stop the spread of this virus. Please don’t knowingly put others at risk. If you’re feeling sick be sure to stay home and social distance. #COVID19 https://t.co/2qVCWZy0re

Anytime anyone tests positive for #COVID19 it’s concerning especially a sitting President. I’m hoping for full recoveries for Pres. Trump his family & staff. This virus is very contagious. I want to remind everyone to wear a mask wash hands & practice social distancing. https://t.co/E7krj1xhc6

NEWS: The #COVID19 relief package we passed tonight includes an estimated $1.77 billion for the state of New Mexico and as much as $335 million in relief for local governments in New Mexico’s 1st Congressional District. #ForThePeople #HeroesAct  https://t.co/GcyWr7jsdd

This crisis exposes the federal government’s failure to meet its trust responsibility.  It’s why I fought to include Tribes in the #CARESAct & the Administration must release those funds. #COVID19  https://t.co/NIv05KhuU3

More than 200K Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19–that’s 200K families who lost a loved one & are forced to live without them.  The most heartbreaking part many of those deaths could have been avoided w/ a proper federal response to this crisis.https://t.co/N2ig8TugEY

Happy #SmallBusinessWeek! New Mexico’s small businesses are the lifeblood of our economy.   During this #COVID19 crisis we must continue to support our small businesses & ensure they have the resources they need to keep their doors open. https://t.co/foG5wSgISq

As our communities focus on the #COVID19 pandemic the Trump Administration is proposing a plan to increase drilling in the Greater Chaco Region. Join Pueblo Navajo and New Mexico leaders in urging @SecBernhardt to postpone this process. #ProtectChaco https://t.co/uXm6G1lCXM

#COVID19 presents new challenges for those struggling with mental health. @BernCounty has resources to prevent suicide & help families get through this tough time. #SuicidePreventionMonth #SuicidePrevention https://t.co/xGuMLj9Oy3

Las comunidades hispana y latinx son esenciales y resilientes: contribuyen a nuestra economía se suman a nuestra rica cultura y están trabajadores esenciales durante esta #COVID19 pandemia. #HispanicHertiageMonth https://t.co/wJdC0PAk6d

Hispanic and Latinx communities are essential and resilient – they contribute to our economy add to our rich culture and are on the frontlines during this #COVID19 pandemic. #HispanicHeritageMonth https://t.co/84QVSAZGG9

Our country is facing crises that are all intertwined: tens of millions of ppl are unemployed #COVID19 rages on racial & economic injustice are getting worse & the #ClimateCrisis accelerates every day. Today we carve out a path for bold economic renewal. It's #TimeToTHRIVE. https://t.co/PiYtJT4J3q

Everyone sees the impacts of the #COVID19 pandemic on the Navajo Nation. The health effects are tremendous from longterm exposure to radiation & acute exposure to radiation that miners experienced. -Leona Morgan Co-founder Nuclear Issues Study Group #EnvironmentalJustice https://t.co/vzj7vvwN9j
Here’s some tips on how to celebrate #LaborDay and stay healthy. #COVID19 https://t.co/iqeaN3MzJA

Firefighters Nurses Paramedics Teachers Sanitation workers  They are all critical to the fight against COVID-19. The Senate GOP needs to face the facts acknowledge the gravity of this crisis and pass the #HeroesAct to deliver the resources frontline workers need to save lives.

Tomorrow at 11:15 a.m. MT / 1:15 p.m. ET @AFT_NM and I will be talking about the need to pass the #HeroesAct to support students teachers and schools during the #COVID19Pandemic. Join us on Instagram. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/LCcJWrbR3O

Our National Guard stepped up to deliver relief to communities yet the Trump Admin refuses to cover the cost. That's why @RepCheri @RepMaxRose & I introduced the UNITED Act to ensure National Guard members have support to fulfill their #COVID19 missions https://t.co/ERLbOr3AdI

One out of four New Mexico students doesn’t have internet access. During the #COVID19 pandemic that means the difference between going to school and being locked out of education. I'm working to increase broadband access for everyone. https://t.co/vH6TTqUsxu

NM’s own @RS21smarter created a report that shows how social factors impact education especially during the #COVID19 pandemic. We need creative solutions so our children can receive the education they deserve. #NMTrue https://t.co/zgQVH2gwcy

NM communities have been hit hard during #COVID19. The House passed the #HeroesAct in May to ensure families stay healthy during this global pandemic & our economy has the support to weather this storm. The Senate needs to pass the #HeroesAct NOW. https://t.co/JUSGIvfHY3

Inaction on climate puts thousands of families and communities at risk every year. And this year with COVID-19 ravaging our country firefighters are at even greater risk. We must #ActOnClimate. https://t.co/t8dxFggVpo

“The toll of the pandemic shows just how pervasive structural racism is” said Olugbenga Ajilore senior economist at the @amprog.   That’s why I’m working for a recovery that will increase racial economic gender and environmental justice. #COVID19 https://t.co/U5k8rh07nf

As we pass 800K people succumbing to COVID-19 in the world & we see our families friends & loved ones struggle with this terrible virus we can all come together in mourning for this incredible loss. Micki McElya’s @washingtonpost piece still rings true. https://t.co/G5Q3buY66F

It wasn't okay when this Administration separated families & now it's even worse as facilities like the one in Cibola County experience #COVID19 outbreaks. @SenatorTomUdall @MartinHeinrich @RepTorresSmall @repbenraylujan & I are holding ICE accountable https://t.co/NArghnYO2g
My heart hurts for the families who have lost a loved one to this virus. We must remain vigilant wear our masks social distance and wash our hands. #AllTogetherNM https://t.co/FRMJhAye64

Native communities have been hit hard by #coronavirus. It’s why I continue to fight to ensure Tribes have the resources to fight this pandemic. https://t.co/weGrsqm2Yy

Because the Trump Administration failed to act and take this pandemic seriously we’re not just facing a coronavirus pandemic we’re facing an economic crisis. We must #Savethe600 & extend the eviction moratorium now: https://t.co/ApI4caioiB

Congratulations @RS21smarter! Proud to have one of @FastCompany’s Top 50 Best Workplaces for Innovators in my district. Their Urban Health Vulnerability Index identifies high-risk communities during the #COVID19 pandemic so we can support them. #NMproud  https://t.co/0M7cVbuiNt
Today #COVID19 unemployment benefits ended for thousands of Americans. It is urgent Senate passes the #HEROESAct to put #FamiliesFirst. https://t.co/Gt9dPXpEWP

Families need support throughout the #coronavirus pandemic but the GOP wants to cut stimulus payments & fund corporations instead. The @nytimes breaks down the differences between their plan and the #HeroesAct @HouseDemocrats passed months ago.   https://t.co/nVzrOwkFox

FACT ✅: No President Trump can’t delay a federal election.   Now let's talk about the real problem: President Trump failed to protect public health & the Senate GOP is tanking our economy by refusing to pass the #HeroesAct. #coronavirus   https://t.co/98wm3xIMlm

#COVID19 has hurt child care facilities making it even harder for working families to find affordable safe care for their children. The Child Care is Essential Act provides relief for families and caregivers while supporting safe environments during the pandemic. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/iHUtBAvpT7

Every community in New Mexico is being impacted by #COVID19. We passed this funding in the #CARESAct to deliver relief for our families. I’m proud to have passed this bill and grateful for the steps @GovMLG is taking to distribute the funding. https://t.co/uvw00mmA3F

While families worry about how they’re going to pay for rent utilities and groceries the GOP insists on pushing many Americans into poverty. We passed the #HeroesAct months ago. They should give it a vote. #COVID19 https://t.co/ZI5t2JpJP1

Millions of families are at risk of losing their homes when the eviction ban ends. Our #HEROESAct extends unemployment benefits & includes housing and utility assistance to support families. #COVID19 https://t.co/moE28DxFJy

30 years after the ADA many people with disabilities continue to live in segregated institutional settings—many heavily impacted by #COVID19. I’m working to increase home & community-based services so everyone no matter their ability can live a full life. #ADA30 https://t.co/5vl7x0jPMA

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act that we passed in April is helping distribute $67 million in Pandemic EBT cards to families with children who rely on free or reduced meals at school.   New Mexico families can call the @NMHSD hotline for more info: 505-660-4822
